column5: Income before tax
column6: The Gini coefficient is a measure of the inequality of the income distribution in a population. Higher values indicate a higher level of inequality. Income here is measured before the payment and receipt of taxes and benefits.
column7: Income is also measured after payment of public and private pensions.

column5: Income before tax
column6: This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries. Income here is measured before the payment and receipt of taxes and benefits.

column5: Wealth
column6: The Gini coefficient is a measure of the inequality of the wealth distribution in a population. Higher values indicate a higher level of inequality. Wealth is defined as the total value of non-financial and financial assets (housing, land, deposits, bonds, equities, etc.) held by households, minus their debts.

column5: description
column6: unit

column5:
The Gini coefficient is a measure of the inequality of the income distribution in a population. Higher values indicate a higher level of inequality.

This is pretax national income. Income here is measured before the payment and receipt of taxes and benefits. Income is also measured after payment of public and private pensions.

Mean income.

This is pretax national income. Income here is measured before the payment and receipt of taxes and benefits. Income is also measured after payment of public and private pensions.
column6: international-$ in 2021 prices

column5:
This is the level of income below which 50% of the population falls.

This is pretax national income. Income here is measured before the payment and receipt of taxes and benefits. Income is also measured after payment of public and private pensions.
